intro: Coleonema pulchrum, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with woody stems and narrow, aromatic leaves. Its flowers are clustered in conical inflorescences, and it blooms during the summer months. Coleonema pulchrum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
